channel.copyright: Copyright 2015 The New York Times Company

item.title: Q. and A.: Who are the Turkmens of Syria?
item.description: Tensions between Russia and Turkey have increased lately over the downing of a Russian warplane in a Turkmen area near the Syrian border.
item.dc:creator: THE NEW YORK TIMES
item.media:description: Alpaslan Celik, center, commander of a Turkmen brigade in Syria, with parts believed to belong to a parachute from a downed Russian aviator near the border with Turkey on Tuesday.

item.title: For Readers of The Times, a Preference for Keeping Liberties in Days of Terror
item.description: Nearly a thousand readers of The New York Times offered views on civil liberties vs. security restrictions in preventing acts of terrorism.
item.dc:creator: HANNA INGBER
item.media:description: Police officers patrolled near the Eiffel Tower in Paris on Monday, part of a major crackdown in the City of Light.

item.title: World Briefing: Haiti: Presidential Vote Results Set Stage for December Run-Off
item.description: The announcement of the top two finishers in the election’s first round set off a new wave of protests around Port-au-Prince.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS
item.media:description: Demonstrators placed burning tires on the street during a march Tuesday in Port-au-Prince.

item.title: World Briefing: Canada: Graft Pervaded Awarding of Contracts in Quebec, Panel Says
item.description: The judge who led the commission said the problem “was broader and more deeply rooted than we believed.”
item.dc:creator: IAN AUSTEN

item.title: An Impasse Over Migration Strands Cubans in Costa Rica
item.description: The crisis has drawn attention to a surge in the number of Cubans leaving the island over the past year.
item.dc:creator: VICTORIA BURNETT

item.title: Terrorism Response Puts Belgium in a Harsh Light
item.description: As Brussels remains locked down for a fourth day, the failure to stop two brothers flagged as extremists before the Paris carnage has highlighted Belgium’s perennial dysfunctions.
item.dc:creator: ANDREW HIGGINS
item.media:description: Belgian soldiers and police officers on patrol Tuesday in central Brussels.

item.title: Meeting With François Hollande, Obama Urges Europe to Escalate ISIS Fight
item.description: The president offered his visiting French counterpart words of solidarity on Tuesday but made it clear that he wanted Europe to increase its efforts to combat the terrorist group.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: PETER BAKER
item.media:description: President Obama met with President François Hollande of France at the White House on Tuesday.

item.title: Letter From the Mideast: Peace Deal Comes With Hummus at Israeli Restaurant
item.description: The owner of the Hummus Bar is giving half off every hummus plate to tables shared by Jews and Arabs.
item.dc:creator: JODI RUDOREN
item.media:credit: Rina Castelnuovo for The New York Times
item.media:description: Kobi Tzafrir, owner of Hummus Bar in Kfar Vitkin, Israel, posted on Facebook that he would give half off every hummus plate to tables shared by Jews and Arabs.

item.title: Two Paris Attackers Planned Another Assault, Prosecutor Says
item.description: Two men who died in a police raid last week appear to have been planning an assault in La Défense, a business district west of Paris, the city’s prosecutor said.
item.dc:creator: AURELIEN BREEDEN

item.title: Abid Naseer Receives 40-Year Sentence for Bomb Plot
item.description: Mr. Naseer, a member of Al Qaeda, was arrested in 2009 after a scheme involving a car bombing at a shopping center in Manchester, England, and an attack on the New York subway system.
item.dc:creator: STEPHANIE CLIFFORD
item.media:credit: U.S. Attorney's Office, via Associated Press
item.media:description: A 2009 surveillance photo of Abid Naseer, right. Mr. Naseer, 29, who was prosecuted in New York, had faced a possible life sentence.

item.title: Tunisia Declares State of Emergency After Explosion on Bus
item.description: President Béji Caïd Essebsi declared a 30-day state of emergency after an explosion in Tunis tore through a bus carrying members of his security guard, killing at least 12 people.
item.dc:creator: FARAH SAMTI and KAREEM FAHIM

item.title: Open Source: Anger at Turkey’s ‘Stab in the Back’ Fills Russian Social Networks and Airwaves
item.description: After Russia’s president called the Turkish strike on one of his nation’s warplanes a “stab in the back,” his words were transformed into a hashtag.
item.dc:creator: ROBERT MACKEY

item.title: Afghan Soldiers and Foreigners Captured After Landing in Taliban-Held Area
item.description: A firefight with the Taliban after the emergency landing killed at least three Afghan soldiers, and at least 13 were taken prisoner, along with two foreigners.
item.dc:creator: MUJIB MASHAL

item.title: Turkey Shoots Down Russian Warplane Near Syrian Border
item.description: It was thought to be the first time a NATO country has shot down a Russian plane in a half-century; tensions immediately took on Cold War overtones.
item.dc:creator: NEIL MacFARQUHAR and STEVEN ERLANGER

item.title: Militants Attack Hotel in Egypt’s Sinai Peninsula, Killing at Least 7
item.description: Egypt’s Islamic State affiliate claimed responsibility for the assault at the hotel in El Arish, which was housing judges who were monitoring parliamentary elections.
item.category: Sinai Province of the Islamic State
item.dc:creator: KAREEM FAHIM

item.title: Vatican Trial Begins Over Leaked Documents
item.description: Five people, including two authors and a monsignor and his assistant, face charges related to information in two books about mismanagement at the Vatican.
item.dc:creator: ELISABETTA POVOLEDO
item.media:description: Gianluigi Nuzzi, center, with Emiliano Fittipaldi, right, the two authors put on trial on Tuesday by the Vatican, leaving the court after the trial was adjourned until next Monday.

item.title: Multiple Errors Cited in U.S. Airstrike on Doctors Without Borders Hospital
item.description: Military officials briefed on the inquiry into the destruction of the hospital in Kunduz, Afghanistan, said the target had been a compound believed to be a Taliban base.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.dc:creator: JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN and ERIC SCHMITT
item.media:credit: Victor J. Blue for The New York Times
item.media:description: The Doctors Without Borders hospital in Kunduz, Afghanistan, after it was hit by an American airstrike in October.

item.title: Paris Attacks Spur Emergency Edict and Intense Policing in France
item.description: With expanded police powers extended for three more months, some, particularly Muslims, question whether the loss of liberties is appropriate.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: ADAM NOSSITER
item.media:credit: Francis Pellier/French Ministry of Interior, via Associated Press
item.media:description: Security forces during a raid in Saint-Denis, north of Paris, last week. The French Parliament voted last week to extend the state of emergency for three more months.

item.title: Iranian Hackers Attack State Dept. via Social Media Accounts
item.description: American officials say cyberespionage is becoming a tool to obtain the influence that many in Iran hoped the nuclear program would give the country.
item.dc:creator: DAVID E. SANGER and NICOLE PERLROTH
item.media:description: Secretary of State John Kerry, second from left, with members of the American delegation in Vienna during nuclear talks with Iran in July. Over the past month, Iranian hackers identified individual State Department officials who focus on Iran and the Middle East and broke into their email and social media accounts.

item.title: Benjamin Netanyahu Plans Separate Bypass Roads for Israelis in Parts of West Bank
item.description: The prime minister said Israeli drivers would be able to bypass certain intersections in the occupied West Bank, where an Israeli soldier was killed in the latest spate of attacks by Palestinians.
item.dc:creator: JODI RUDOREN
item.media:description: Israeli soldiers on Monday near the body of a Palestinian man who was shot dead after fatally stabbing an Israeli soldier, Pvt. Ziv Mizrachi, at a gas station on a highway in the West Bank.
